intro: Diplazium celtidifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf chain fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive fronds that are divided into broad, lance-shaped segments. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and rocky areas. Its rhizome is creeping and produces both sterile and fertile fronds. Diplazium celtidifolium is often found in temperate regions of the southeastern United States and parts of Mexico.
